meanings.sent1: After dinner, she decided to reboil the soup for extra warmth.
meanings.sent2: I always reboil the water when making tea to ensure it's hot enough.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful chef kept reboiling the same pot of water, thinking it was new each time.
meanings.sent4: Her anger was like a pot reboiling on the stove, ready to overflow at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The constant reboiling of the ocean water created a thick fog over the shore.

meanings.definition: The act of boiling a liquid again.
meanings.sent1: The reboiling of the milk caused it to scorch and stick to the pan.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the reboiling of the kettle from the other room.
meanings.sent3: The reboiling of the tea made it taste stronger than before.
meanings.sent4: The reboiling of the soup gave it a richer flavor.
meanings.sent5: The constant reboiling of the water led to a decrease in its purity.
